intro: Dipteracanthus pohlii, commonly known as the Pohli's dipterocarp, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae, which includes many tropical tree species. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers and is often found in lowland rainforests. It plays an important role in the ecosystem as a source of nectar for various pollinators. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
